author: Jake Edmiston
title: Mushroom farmer forced to destroy $40,000 worth of crop as oversupply wreaks havoc on food industry
description: Surpluses are one of the main complications to ripple through the food chain since the food-service sector's near-total shutdown in mid-March
content:
Carleton Mushroom Farms had a problem. A third of its sales had disappeared as the restaurant industry shut down due to the coronavirus crisis.
But the farm just south of Ottawa in Osgoode, Ont., was still sprouting 200,000 pounds of button, cremini and port… [+6052 chars]
